bibl.title: Outposts of empire: Vindolanda, Egypt, and the empire of Rome
bibl.note: Revised version of the Inaugural Lecture as Camden Professor of Ancient History, University of Oxford, St John's College, June 13, 2003. - The evidence of written documents from Egypt and Britain shows dominant patterns in the military organisation, administration, law, social life, cultural religious institutions which belong, recognisably, to the same world of Rome. - Pp. 91: Appendix: William Camden and the Camden Lectures; - 91-93: References.
bibl.seg: BOWMAN Alan K., Outposts of Empire: Vindolanda, Egypt, and the Empire of Rome.

Revised version of the Inaugural Lecture as Camden Professor of Ancient History, University of Oxford, St John's College, June 13, 2003. - The evidence of written documents from Egypt and Britain shows dominant patterns in the military organisation, administration, law, social life, cultural religious institutions which belong, recognisably, to the same world of Rome. - Pp. 91: Appendix: William Camden and the Camden Lectures; - 91-93: References.
